byline: Sally Herships, David Brancaccio, Ann Carrns, Cintra Wilson and Noel King
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, March 25, 2014
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, March 25, 2014
description: With a report from the New American Foundation showing a problematic 8 percent rise in debt levels for graduate students over the last four years, Marketplace puts the value of a law degree on trial. Plus, a look at a new report that breaks down by state the 32 million people in the U.S. who are underinsured, meaning they have health coverage but it’s not robust enough to keep them from shouldering high costs when they get sick. Also, a conversation about how millennials are approaching the twists and turns of the present day economy from mounting student loan debt to securing employment in a still rocky job market. And as part of our New York Times’ series, reporter Ann Carrns met with one young man who decided plumbing was the best way for him to get ahead.
